loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo de 64 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y es padre de dos hijos en las edades de 42 y 31 años.  Allí se dedica a la venta de víveres y lácteos especialmente de queso, negocio que inició hace un poco más de 30 años, después que quedara desempleado, pues trabajaba en una empresa importante del país. Él empezó vendiendo arroz, aceite y  en general artículos de la canasta familiar y posteriormente se posicionó en la venta de queso por kilos que distribuye en tiendas, puntos comerciales y entre clientes fijos que le encargan, porque conocen la calidad con la cual Bernardo trabaja. Su mercado se extiende cada vez más, pero Bernardo no tiene el suficiente capital de trabajo para inyectar a su negocio y crecer más rápidamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, víveres en mayor volumen, pues tiene muchas cuentas por cobrar, que no alcanza a recuperar en corto tiempo y nuevos clientes que hacen pedidos y con ellos le cuesta trabajo ser oportuno en la entrega de los productos. La razón de éxito de su inversión es que  logrará financiar su cartera de créditos y responder rápidamente a nuevos clientes con los cuales fortalecerá aun más sus ventas y su base de clientes. Su meta mas adelante es lograr tener un punto comercial y un vehículo para transportar sus pedidos; auguramos que con su persistente trabajo y disciplina Bernardo muy seguramente alcanzará todo lo que se proponga, para lograr cada vez mas bienestar.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 64, lives in the south of the city; he’s the father of two children who are 42 and 31 years old.  He sells groceries and dairy products, especially cheese, a business he started a little more than 30 years ago when he became unemployed; he used to work for an important firm in the country.

He started off selling rice, oil and basic staple items in general and later on added selling cheese by the kilo to stores, commercial points and among regular customers that place orders with him because they are aware of the good quality Bernardo handles.  

His market expands more each time but Bernardo does not have enough working capital to inject into his business to grow more quickly which is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy groceries in larger amounts because he has several accounts receivable that prevent him from collecting in the short term and new customers placing orders that he finds difficult to fill in a timely way.

His investment will be successful because he’ll manage to finance his credit portfolio and respond rapidly to new customers which will strengthen his sales and his customer base even more.

His goal for later on is to have a commercial point and a vehicle to transport his orders.  We [FMSD] are sure that with persistent work and discipline, Bernardo will surely reach all his goals attaining more wellbeing each time.

loans.use: to buy groceries in larger amounts.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha de 48 años de edad es habitante de Granada, casada, madre de 4 hijos solo el menor esta a su cargo, ella realizo estudios hasta la primaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 20 años.  Inicio su actividad con su primer esposo en un  tramo que tenían en el mercado, luego por problemas matrimoniales se separo y tuvo que comprarle el tramo para continuar con el negocio comenzando con poquito inventario, después fue invirtiendo con ahorros y apoyo de otras instituciones, actualmente recibe el apoyo de su compañero de vida que le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad, su expectativa es crecer en productos que aun no tiene en existencias y que le demanda la clientela.
 Realiza el préstamo para comprar granos básicos  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, etc. Ella estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá surtir su puesto el cual le traerá  mayores ventas y a la vez podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes con el objetivo de seguir creciendo en su negocio para un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Martha, who is 48 years old, lives in Granada. She is married and has four children. Her youngest child is the only who lives with her currently. She has an elementary school education, and has sold groceries for twenty years. She began her business with her first husband with a space in the local market. As a result of marital problems, she separated from her husband and had to purchase the space from him to continue her business. She had very little inventory at the time, but has been investing her savings and has received loans from other institutions. Currently, she receives help from her lifer partner, who helps her with household costs. She sells her products in her community, and she hopes to increase her inventory of products which she currently does not have but which her customers have requested.
She is requesting the loan to purchase basic goods such as rice, beans, and sugar, etc. She believes the loan will help her to be able to fill her market space, which will provide her with better sales and satisfy her customers’ requests at the same time. Her goal is for her business to keep growing so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods such as rice, beans, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.es:
Reginaldo, está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la crianza de cerdos y venta de refrescos, él comprara refrescos, agua en bolsa, gaseosas, y tambien dos cerdos,  esto le ayudara para mejorar su negocio y tener la posibilidad de generar mejores ventas.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a mejorar el negocio en la produccion de flores, en su familia se han mantenido las condiciones y dentro del negocio él desea ir creciendo.
texts.en:
Reginaldo is seeking a loan to invest in raising pigs and selling soft drinks.  He will buy soft drinks, water, refreshments, and also two pigs.  This will help him improve his business and give him the possibility of increasing his sales.

He had a good experience with his previous loan.  It helped improve his flower production business.  His family has maintained their living conditions, and with this business he hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, refreshments, and also two pigs.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en: When Phyllis was in 9th grade, she enrolled in an elective photography class which was the gateway to her passion for photography and design. Since then, Phyllis has been in photography for 15 years. “I decided to take that hobby and turn it into a career,” she says. Phyllis, age 45, with a Bachelor in Marketing, returned to school to complete her degree in Computers and Graphic Design. While in college, Phyllis obtained two internships: one in marketing and another working on computers. The marketing internship was not for her. “I would get off work and take time to photograph,” she says. Soon after, Phyllis received compliments. “Maybe someone is willing to pay me for this,” she thought. “I’m going to slowly build the program.” In January, Phyllis opened "PJE Multimedia" in Shreveport. Phyllis plans to assist other local businesses with creating and assembling their websites. Another aspect of Phyllis’ work is her ability to manipulate a photo to please clients. For example, she photographed an elementary class and, for one parent, Phyllis swapped her child, who was standing on the end, with the child who was standing front and center. However, Phyllis says she wants to focus more on web design and graphics until she can fully develop her photography business plan. When she photographs, Phyllis tries to capture the essence of her subject. “The purpose is to portray the photos as art,” she says. Phyllis advises her customers: “Tell me what’s on your mind, and if I can’t do it, I’ll tell you.” After attending a lecture on small business administration at Louisiana State University, Phyllis inquired about a loan from ACCION Texas Inc. instead of a traditional bank. Recently approved, she will use the loan to purchase a lighting kit which includes lights, a green screen background and a small black background for torso and head shots. The loan will also fund product research. Phyllis plans to work with another company to print her photos on shirts but she needs to know the shirts won’t wither after a couple of washes. “If a company is not up to par, I’ll switch companies,” she says. At the moment, Phyllis does not employ anyone else but she plans to contract a model to be on-call and pose in the shirts with her photos on them. “I don’t want to feel like I have to make a quarter,” she says. “I just want to make a picture and approach a client …. The money is nice, but the emotional reaction from clients is better.” For more information about PJE Multimedia, visit her website at: www.pjemultimedia.com.

loans.use: to purchase lights, a green screen and a small black backdrop for photos.

loans.name: Temitha Group

texts.en:
Sento is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sento was born in Makeni city about thirty-five years ago. She is married to a tailor, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Sento sells cooked foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots). She has been a businesswoman for five years now.
 
With the help of this loan, Sento and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. Sento will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy cooking ingredients like uncooked foo-foo, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, onions, tomatoes, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients like uncooked foo-foo, margi, pepper, onions, tomatoes, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two children. 

For the past 12 years he has been working in the car services industry and has had his own business for car washing and lubrication. Recently, Karim diversified his sources of income and started trading carpets in his neighborhood.

Karim is applying for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a pick-up truck to transfer his products, mainly lubricants and carpets from the wholesaler to his shop and at times to the customers’ homes. Karim is always considering ways to expand his work activities and generate more income to raise the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck to transfer his products.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man and the father of three children. 

As his region, Baalbeck, is famous for its agricultural activity, Mohammad started his own cultivation business at the age of 17. Until today, he has been planting and selling fresh and organic apples, apricots, peaches, and plums. He also operates his tractor for plowing his and other’s lands.

Mohammad is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the money to register his van to operate it in transporting his produce to markets outside his area, such as Beirut. In selling his goods in the capital, Mohammad can generate more income than he would back in his hometown; consequently he would provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to register his van to operate it in transporting his produce to markets outside his area.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de unos repuestos para el vehículo, comprara la caja de velocidades, fricciones y llantas, esto le ayudara para mantener su carro en buenas condiciones, haciendole una buena inversion general.
Con el préstamo anterior logro terminar la compra de unos lotes donde construirá  para su familia, él ha mejorado su condición económica familiar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He would like to purchase a gearbox, brakes, and wheels, which will help him to keep his car running in good condition. This would be a good general investment for him.
With his previous loan, Ricardo finished purchasing a couple lots where he will build a home for his family. This loan has helped him to improve his family’s financial state.

loans.use: to purchase a gearbox, brakes, and wheels.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria, esta solicitando un préstamo para seguir trabajando en su negocio, comprara materia prima para hacer pupusas, maíz, aceite, condimentos, quesillo, chicharrones, con los que espera tener la oportunidad de crecer en las ventas y le ayude a generar mas ganancias.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, pues invirtio en los cosmeticos, ayudandole a tener una variedad para sus clientes tambien en la pupuseria conto con todo lo necesario para seguir ofreciendo pupusas a los clientes, mejorando su clientela y las ganancias a la familia.
texts.en:
Maria is asking for this loan to keep working on her business.  She will buy raw materials to make pupusas, such as corn, oil, condiments, cheese, and pork rinds, with which she hopes to have the opportunity to increase her sales and make more profits.

Her last loan had a very positive effect, as she invested it in cosmetics, which helped her have a variety to offer her customers, and it also helped her pupusa shop.  She was able to count on having everything she needed to keep selling her customers pupusas, which improved her clientele and her family's earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, condiments, cheese, and pork rinds

loans.name: Luisa Morena

texts.es:
Luisa, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de seguir en su negocio, ya que es su fuente de ingresos, quiere utilizar este préstamo en la compra de lociones, cosméticos de belleza como labiales, cremas,  maquillajes, que le incrementen la posibilidad de ganar dinero.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior le aumentaron las ventas y que su condición de vida está más solvente económicamente.
texts.en:
Luisa decided to ask for a new loan so that she can continue her business.  It is her source of income and she wants to use this loan to buy lotions and beauty products such as lipstick, creams, and makeup.  This will give her the opportunity to earn more money.

She says that with her previous loan, she increased her sales and can now meet her financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy lotions, lipsticks, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: John B.'s Group

texts.en:
These are the staff members of a reputable institution in Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. This hard-working and dedicated staff has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they repay their loans by using their monthly salaries. Their financial officer is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

John is the leader of this team. A native of Matamp village in northern Sierra Leone, the 48-year-old is married and has nine children attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. John has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. He will buy four bushels of rice seeds and pay labor. He will also use a part of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy four bushels of rice seeds, pay labor, and use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
Maritza, una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad, vive en un Barrio de San Pedro Sula junto a su pareja y sus 3 hijos y se ayudan mutuamente, su esposo con sus ahorros le apoyo para que iniciara un negocio, al ver la oportunidad ella decidió poner un puesto de venta de comida, ofreciendo desayunos, baleadas, pollos fritos y almuerzos y refrescos, aparte de vender comida, también se dedica al comercio vendiendo mercadería como un ingreso extra. 
Ahora con ODEF a solicitado un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para ampliar su servicios y vender también churros, dulces, jugos, pasteles etc. Además invertir en comprar alguna mercadería que le hace falta, e insumos para la venta de comida y de esta manera hacer rendir más el negocio, y que le generen más ingresos para el sostenimiento económico del hogar.
Manifiesta que esta agradecida con ODEF y KIVA por la ayuda adquirida y su meta principal es llegar a tener su propia casa para instalar allí su negocio para hacerlo crecer aun más.
texts.en:
Maritza is a hardworking, 30 year old woman living in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with her spouse and three children; they all help each other out.  Her husband used his savings to help her start a business.  She saw the opportunity to open a food stand selling breakfasts, ‘baleadas’ [stuffed flour tortillas], fried chicken, lunches and refreshments.  In addition to selling food she also sells general merchandise as a way of earning extra income.

She’s asking ODEF for a 15,000 lempira loan to expand her services and also sell snacks, candy, juice, cakes, etc. as well as to buy some merchandise she needs and ingredients needed to make her dishes so that the business will produce more and generate more income for her home’s economic support.

She states that she’s grateful to ODEF and KIVA for the help she’s gotten and her main goal is to have a house of her own to set up her business there and make it grow even more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, corn, firewood, cheese, gas, and condiments

loans.name: Dennis Osmin

texts.es:
Dennis tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad, vive en un barrio céntrico de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Dennis desde hace 10 años se dedica a trabajar dando el servicio de taxi. La ruta que el hace es del centro de la ciudad a los centros comerciales que existen en los alrededores de la misma. Dennis tiene mucha experiencia en este trabajo ya que siempre se ha dedicado a este rubro trabajando para otras personas. Fue entonces que decidió tener su propio taxi para generar sus propios ingresos, los cuales manifiesta son muy rentables. 
El lleva 2 prestamos con ODEF, ahora el necesita el tercer préstamo de 6,500 lempiras para compra de amortiguador para el taxi para seguir trabajando y dando un mejor servicio a los usuarios.
Su meta es seguir trabajando con mucho esfuerzo, lograr pagar por completo el taxi y tener una solvencia económica que respalde cualquier necesidad en el futuro.
texts.en:
Dennis, 36, is married and has two children who are 6 and 5 years old; he lives in a centrally located neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Dennis has worked providing taxi services for ten years.  His route is from downtown to shopping centers located around town.  Dennis has much experience in this line of work since he’s always worked at this for others.  Eventually, he decided to have a taxi of his own to generate his own income; he states that it’s very profitable.

He’s had two ODEF loans and now needs a third one for 6,500 lempiras to buy shock absorbers for his taxi so that he can continue working and giving good customer service.  His goal is to continue working very hard in order to pay off his taxi and attain economic solvency to be able to meet any future need.

loans.use: to buy shock absorbers for his taxi.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
Jose, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, tiene la oportunidad de comprarse dos novillas, un torete y una vaca, esto le ayudara a incrementar su hato ganadero, en un futuro podrá sacarle ganancia a esta compra.
El manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con su primer préstamo, que le aumentado su ganadería, cambiando sus condiciones familiares, generándole mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan to invest in the business; he has the opportunity of buying two heifers, a bullock and a cow which will help him increase his herd size.  In the future he’ll be able to benefit from this purchase.

He states that he had a good experience with his first loan because his cattle increased changing his family condition and generating better income.

loans.use: to buy two heifers, a bullock and a cow.

loans.name: Ingrid Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ingrid, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el negocio, invirtiendo en ropa nueva blusas, camisetas, ropa para niños, ropa interior, entre otros que son parte para atender la demanda.
Ella comenta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para surtir el negocio, sus ventas están estables y su familia se ha mantenido, ella continua con deseos de trabajar con prestamos para poderse superar en el comercio.
texts.en:
Ingrid is asking for a new loan to improve the business investing in new clothes like blouses, t-shirts, children’s clothes and underwear, among others to meet demand.

She comments that the previous loan helped her stock the business; her sales are stable and her family has been supported.  She continues with the desire to work with loans to be able to excel in business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, de 52 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 4 hijos, tres son mayores de edad, estando a su cargo solo el menor de sus hijos, ella realizo sus estudio hasta la secundaria, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, ella con el apoyo de créditos a logrado surtir su  negocio que le han permitido aumentar sus ingresos.  
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como artículos del hogar, platos y adornos de vidrios y cosméticos alusivos al mes de las madres, con el objetivo de mantener en su pulpería todos los productos que le solicita el cliente, ella espera como planes futuros cancelar el préstamo e invertir en mejorar la infraestructura del negocio.
texts.en:
Fifty-two-year-old Sandra is originally from Granada.  She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom are adults.  She still cares for the youngest of her children.  She has a secondary education and she is the shopkeeper of a small grocery store for a living.  With the help of loans, she has been able to stock her business, which has allowed her to increase her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy products such as household items, plates, glass ornaments, and cosmetics in keeping with the month of Mother's Day.  Her goal is to have all of the products her customers ask for in her market.  Her future plans are to pay off her loan and invest in improving her business' infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy products such as household items, plates, glass ornaments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un préstamo para la compra de mas inventario para el negocio, pues quiere tener surtido de productos frescos, comprándose papas, zanahorias, güisquiles, mangos, papayas, sandia, además comprara ropa usada para tener a la venta.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para que sus ventas se incrementaran y ampliar el negocio surtiendolo de ropa y frutas, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y espera seguir creciendo y prosperando.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy stock for her business as she wants to have a range of fresh products. She will buy potatoes, carrots, pear squashes, mangoes, papayas and watermelons, as well as second-hand clothes to sell. 

She says that the previous loan helped her to increase her sales and to expand the business by stocking it with clothes and fruit. Her economic situation has improved and she hopes to continue expanding and prospering.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, pear squashes, mangoes, papayas, watermelons and clothes.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
MARIA FERNANDA tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad vive con el esposo y con y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

 MARIA FERNANDA se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de frutas. Solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, barilla, eternit.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar el mejoramineto de vivienda . Las compras las realizará en Guaranda.
El sueño es poder educar a los hijos.

 Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es trabajar duro para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los hijos y arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Fernanda is 32 years old, is married and has two children who are 6 and 4 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Maria Fernanda earns her living selling all sorts of different fruits. She is asking for a loan to buy cement, soda ash and eternit brand fibre-reinforced cement. With the loan she will be able to improve her home. She will buy the products in Guaranda. 

Her dream is to be able to give her children an education.The challenge she faces is to work hard to improve her living conditions. In her free time she enjoys looking after her children and spending time fixing-up her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, soda ash and eternit brand fibre-reinforced cement.

loans.name: Manuel Mercedes

texts.es:
Manuel, está solicitando un préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, pues su clientela está creciendo, demandándole más servicios fotográficos, él comprara papel de fotografía, químico, tinta y cuadros para abastecer el negocio.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas y obtener mejores ingresos. En su familia el número de miembros se mantiene, están mejorando sus situaciones económicas.
texts.en:
Manuel is asking for a loan because he needs to invest more in the business because his clientele is growing and requesting more photography services.  He will buy photographic paper, chemicals, ink and frames to stock the business.

He had a positive effect with the previous loan because it helped him improve his sales and obtain better income.  The number of members of his family remains stable; their economic situations are improving.

loans.use: to buy photographic paper, chemicals, ink and frames.

loans.name: Edwar Ruben

texts.es:
Edwar es un hombre muy trabajador, es padre de un pequeño de 8 añosa de edad, por quien trabaja muy duro y sobre todo con mucho a ánimo para poder darle una vida de calidad y sobre todo una vida feliz. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona. En este distrito se desarrolla la agricultura, asimismo se le conoce por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear, en ocasiones también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Edwar trabaja en su negocio de renovadora de calzado, él le dedica  a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y cumplido con sus clientes por ello siempre lo recomiendan.

Edwar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar cuero, hilo para coser zapatos, cola, plantillas, entre otros; de esta manera tendrá los implementos necesarios para realizar sus trabajo; así el podrá seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su empresa de fabricación de calzado”.
texts.en:
Edwar is a very hardworking man.  He is the father an eight-year-old little boy for whom he works very hard and, more than anything, with a lot of drive to be able to give him a quality life and, most of all, a happy life.  Their home is in the district of Parcona.  This is an agrarian district that is also known for the generosity of its inhabitants.  When he has free time, he likes to go for walks and he also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "arroz con pollo."

Edwar works at his shoe repair business with a lot of enthusiasm.  He spends about 10 hours per day there and he can see up to 15 customers daily.  He believes his business is doing well because he is very responsible and polite to his customers, which is why they recommend him.

Edwar is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy leather, thread to sew shoes, glue, and soles, among other things.  This will give him the tools he needs to do his work, which will allow him to keep fighting day after day to achieve his greatest dream: to have a shoemaking business.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread to sew shoes, glue, and soles, among other things

loans.name: Jackine

texts.en:
Jackine is a 39-year-old lady, married to Simon, and blessed with four children -- a 17 and 15 year old and 6-year-old twins. She is in the hotel business, which she started two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She is requesting for her first loan with KADET KES 30,000 to purchase a microwave and five bales of maize flour. The profit she earns from her business will contribute towards her buying a piece of land and building her business premises. 

Her dream is to be a prominent business woman and to help the less fortunate in the society.

loans.use: to purchase a microwave and two bales of maize flour.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel tiene 26 años y es soltero con un  hijo que es de la edad de 2 añitos, el se dedica a la  confección y venta de prendas de vestir, el vende en su puesto de venta que es en uno de los mercados de la localidad de El Torno, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Miguel usara este préstamo  para la compra de rollos de tela  para la confección de prendas de vestir, por esta razón solicito  este préstamo ya que le falta capital de trabajo para la compra de tela polar, el Sr. Miguel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, sueña por su negocio es tener un  negocio estable y poder netregra sus productos a distintos mercados d la ciudad de santa Cruz, el Sr. Miguel es un joven emprendedor se siente agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Miguel is 26 years old and he is single with a two-year-old son.  He makes and sells clothes for a living, selling from his stand in one of the markets in the town of El Torno.  This will be his first loan cycle with the institution.  Miguel will use the loan to buy rolls of fabric to make clothing.  He is asking for this loan because he does not have enough working capital to buy fleece fabric.  Miguel faces challenges in his business, such as growing his clientele, and he will use his profits to improve his family's quality of life.  His dream is to have a stable business and to be able to offer his products in different markets in the city of Santa Cruz.  Miguel is an enterprising young man and he is thankful for the opportunity that has been offered to him.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra y venta de ganado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos ya adultos, tiene 10 años de estar dedicado al comercio del ganado y la siembra de granos básicos, con esto ha logrado tener ingresos para su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para el cultivo  como el abono, herbicidas, y compra de dos vaquillas, este préstamo le ayudara para crecer en la ganadería y a poder realizar la siembra de maíz.
La aspiración de José es crecer en el negocio, para poder sustentar mejor el cultivo y obtener buenas cosechas, de las cuales su familia se verá beneficiada.
texts.en:
José works in farming and buying and selling livestock for a living.  He lives with his wife and three adult children.  He has been in the business of livestock and planting staple grains for 10 years and, through this work, he has been able to generate income for his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for his crop, such as fertilizer and herbicides, and also to buy two heifers.  This loan will help him develop his livestock business and be able to plant corn.

José's goal is to grow his business in order to take better care of his crop and have good harvests, which will benefit his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crop, such as fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 38 years old, married to Simon and blessed with a 14-year-old son. She is in the hotel business, which she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 12,700. 

She is requesting KES 30,000 for her first loan to purchase a refrigerator for proper food storage in the hotel. The profit she earns from her business will contribute towards her buying a plot where she will later build her house. 

Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and an oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to the supplies she has and buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is married and has two children.  She sells clothes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for twelve years.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  Her business has grown since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

Anne hopes to grow her business.  She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy additional clothes stock.

loans.use: to add clothes stock.

loans.name: Mirella

texts.en: Serving non-traditional shoppers, Mirella, 55, opened It’s New To Me, a women’s clothing store, on April 28. The shop is located on a main street, 30 blocks outside downtown Laredo, Texas. At It’s New to Me, Mirella sells dresses, jewelry, purses, some shoes, candles and other accessories. Though she currently sells women’s apparel, Mirella plans to expand and sell new and gently-used furniture. She also plans to open a small snack shop within her store to enhance the shopping experience. Mirella wanted to be her own boss, which influenced her to become an entrepreneur. “I don’t want to work for someone else all my life,” she says. Her cousin owns a furniture resale shop in Corpus Christi, Texas and inspired Mirella to do the same. As she moves out of her current location (which requires all vendors to sell new items), Mirella plans to obtain furniture to sell. Mirella’s cousin was also the person who informed her about Accion Texas Inc., which saved a trip to a traditional bank. Upon approval of the loan, Mirella purchased inventory for the store. The combination of the loan and her savings paid for business cards, a 13-week ad in Laredo’s Bargain Book, a new sign, rent, fire department and other necessary permits, and part of the deposit. She says the loan will also help her buy the initial merchandise she needs. Mirella currently employs her daughter-in-law and does not plan to hire more employees until her business flourishes. She plans to re-invest her earnings into the growth of It’s New to Me and have a Grand Opening party in the near future to notify the community of her store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and pay start-up fees.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 33-year-old single woman. She has owned her grocery shop for 15 years now, selling a variety of products ranging from vegetables, sweets, and drinks to even detergents. Her customers are the people of her village who trust the quality of her goods and favor her pleasant and friendly attitude. 

Rabab is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua with which she will purchase additional goods to sell at her store. This will allow her to expand her business and consequently generate more income for herself. With the money left from the loan, Rabab will assist her brother by supporting his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell at her store.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La señora Nieves tiene 39 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene 5 hijos de las edades de 12, 10, 8, 6 y 4 años, la Sra. Nieves es una señora líder, que trabajo excelente en una banca comunal, ahora trabaja de manera individual ella tiene el negocio de la venta de pantalones de varón en la feria 16 de julio, su puesto es propio , ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos, el mayor de ellos se enfermo de apendicitis y pese a esta situación ella logro salir adelante  con el apoyo de su familia, la señora nieves es muy trabajadora, y solidaria con sus compañeras su meta es sacar profesionales a sus hijos  y tener una casa propia para brindarles mayor comodidad, con el dinero del crédito comprar pantalones al por mayor para esta época de frio, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien,  la Sra. Nieves es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Nieves is thirty-nine years old and is not married, although she lives with her partner and their five children. Her children are twelve, ten, eight, six, and four years old. Nieves is a leader who worked excellently with her communal bank and who now works individually. She sells men’s pants in the 16 de julio market, and she owns her stand. She lives with her husband and children. Her eldest got sick with appendicitis, but in spite of this situation, she was able to get ahead with the help of her family. Nieves is very hard-working and works well with her companions. Her goal is to see her children become professionals and to have a house of her own so she can make them more comfortable. She will use the loan money to purchase pants at wholesale prices for the cold season. Her previous loan helped her very much. Nieves is a hard-working person, and she is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of pants for the cold season so she can stock her sales stand.

loans.name: Gregoria Arely

texts.es:
Gregoria, vive con su madre, está soltera, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas este negocio tiene más de dos años, realiza en dos turnos por la mañana la venta de pupusas y por la mediodía la venta de las tortillas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para realizar la venta, como el maíz, aceite, condimentos, gas, leña, materiales para empaque de las pupusas, quesillo y chicharrón,  esto le ayudara a mejorar su ventas, teniendo todo lo necesario para seguir trabajando.
La aspiración de Gregoria que su negocio crezca, hacer llegar más clientela, con el fin de generar mayores ganancias para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Gregoria is single and lives with her mother. She works selling tortillas and pupusas [thick handmade corn tortillas stuffed with fillings like cheese and ground pork]. Her business, which is more than two years old, operates in two shifts: in the morning she sells pupusas, and at midday she sells tortillas.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies for her business, like corn, oil, seasonings, gas, firewood, supplies for wrapping pupusas, quesillo [a soft cheese], and chicharrón [cooked pork ground to a paste]. This will help her improve her sales, having everything necessary to continue working.

Gregoria's dream is that her business will grow, bringing more customers, with the aim of generating greater earnings to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, seasonings, gas, and firewood.

loans.name: Amcelmo

texts.es:
El señor Amcelmo de 40 años de edad habitante del departamento de Teustepe es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, soltero, padre de 3 hijos que tiene a su cargo. Inicio su actividad sembrando  para otros agricultores a la edad de quince años mientras , su familia se dedicaba a trabajos de ganadería y siembra para consumo propio, luego el decidio independizarse a la edad de veinte años empezo a sembrar  2 manzanas de frijol que con el tiempo y arduo trabajo  logro ampliarlas para sembrar hasta 15 manzanas, en la actividad cuenta con 20 años de experiencia y dominio siendo apoyado actualmente por su familia comercializando sus productos en Managua porque cuenta con un mercado mas amplio en comercio, le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos en lugares donde sean escasos para poder vender a un mejor precio.
Su expectativa es seguir trabajando en la actividad ya que es un negocio que le gusta pues ha podido salir adelante y comprar tierras con las ganancias. Realiza el préstamo para comprar tierras y insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, plaguisida y abono, sus planes a futuros es comprar ganado para obtener otros ingresos, sus metas próximas es llegar a ampliar el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Ancelmo, 40, lives in Teustepe Department; he’s a farmer growing basic grains.  He’s single and the father of three children in his care.  

He started his activity planting for other farmers at the age of fifteen while his family worked raising cattle and farming for their own consumption.  Later, he decided at the age of 20 to become independent and started planting two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of beans which in time and with hard work he succeeded in expanding to 15 manzanas.  

He has 20 years’ experience and command of this activity and he’s helped mainly by is family selling the products in Managua because the market there is larger.  He’d like to make his products known in places where they are scarce so that he can sell them at a better price.

His hope is to continue working in this activity since it’s a business that he likes because he’s managed to get ahead and to buy land with his profits.

He’s taking out the loan to buy land and farm supplies like fertilizer, bug killers and manure.  His future plan is to buy cattle to earn additional income and his short-term goal is to expand the planted area.

loans.use: to buy land and farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 3 años de edad, José aprendió esta labor por sus padres, cuando formo su familia le dio continuidad para poder trabajar en lo propio y tener una fuente de ingreso para su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semilla de maíz, abono y herbicidas, este préstamo le dará lo necesario para iniciar la siembra y tener a tiempo los materiales para aplicarlos al cultivo.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es poder realizar un buen cultivo, que le dé una buena cosecha, para poder mejorar sus ingresos a la familia, ofreciéndole a través del trabajo  mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José works growing corn.  He lives with his wife and three year old son.  José learned this line of work from his parents and when he formed his own family he continued with it in order to work for himself and have a source of family income.

He’s asking for a loan to buy corn seeds, manure and herbicide.  This loan will give him what’s needed to start planting and to have the materials to apply to the crops on time.

His goal with the loan is to have a good crop that will produce a good harvest to improve his family income offering them through his work a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan, es agricultor y ganadero, vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos de 2, 4 y 9 años de edad, Juan tiene experiencia en el trabajo, pues empezó desde muy pequeño, aprendió con su padre y tiene 10 años de estar realizándolo solo en lo propio.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, que son los materiales necesarios para el proceso de la siembra y el crecimiento de las matas de maíz, con este préstamo tendrá los recursos para poder mejorar la productividad de la siembra.
El objetivo de Juan es mejorar la economía del hogar con su esfuerzo, para darles a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer and cattleman.  He lives in his own house with his wife and three children who are 2, 4 and 9 years of age.  

Juan has experience in this work since he started very young learning from his father.  He’s been working now on his own for ten years and he’s asking for a loan to buy corn seeds, manure and herbicide that are the supplies needed for the planting process and for the growth of his corn plants.  With this loan he’ll have the resources to improve crop productivity.

Juan’s objective is to improve his home’s economy by means of his efforts to give his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, vive en casa de un tío, con su propia familia, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene 5 años de trabajar en lo propio, aprendió de sus padres y tiene la experiencia como para realizar esta actividad por sus propios medios. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla de maíz y frijol, para sembrar tambien comprara abono y herbicidas, los cuales los aplicara para fortalecer la plantación y prevenirla de plagas, con este préstamo contara con el recurso económico para poder invertir en la productividad de los granos básicos.
El objetivo de José es trabajar por mantener su hogar, tener las condiciones adecuadas y poder seguir produciendo granos básicos.
texts.en:
José lives in a house belonging to an uncle with his own family.  He’s been working on his own for five years growing corn.  He learned from his parents and has experience in doing this activity on his own.

He’s asking for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds to plant also.  He will buy manure and herbicide that he will apply to strengthen his plants and prevent infestations.  With this loan he will have the economic resources to invest in the production of basic grains.

José’s objective is to work to support his home and to have the adequate conditions to continue producing basic grains.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Synia Yanira

texts.es:
Synia, vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de tres niños de 4, 6 y 8 años de edad, ella trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijol, ella ha aprendido con su padre todo el proceso agrícola, tiene 11 años de estar realizando este trabajo para el sustento familiar. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla de maíz y de frijol, con esto estará lista para poder iniciar la siembra, con el préstamo podrá tener el apoyo económico para comprarse los materiales y poder aplicarlos a la siembra, con lo que espera tener una buena cosecha.
La aspiración de Synia es mejorar su economía, con su trabajo en la agricultura espera sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Synia lives with her parents; she’s a single mother of three children who are 4, 6 and 8 years old.  She works in agriculture growing corn and beans.  She’s learned from her father everything about the agricultural process.  She’s been in this line of work for eleven years to support her family.

She’s asking for a loan to buy manure, herbicide and corn and bean seeds.  With this she’ll be ready to plant and with the loan she’ll have economic support to buy the materials to apply to the crops hoping for a good harvest.

Synia’s hope is to improve her economy; with her work in agriculture she hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Jacobina

texts.es: La Sra. Jacobina tiene 62 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son 35 y 28, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos de moconchinchi refresco de durazno seco, su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona Independencia, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la  institución, la Sra. Jacobina va a usar este préstamo de para la compra de mercadería (durazno seco) para la elaboración de sus refrescos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. Jacobina  y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas  moconchinchi (durazno seco) ya que esta época incrementa su costo y ella desea tener por mayor, para asi no preocuparse por la falta de este producto, La Sra. Jacobina se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jacobina is 62 years old, married, and has two children, ages 35 and 28.  She makes a living selling food and moconchinchi, a soft drink made from dried peaches.  Her stand is located in the Independencia area in the city of Cochabamba.  This is Jacobina’s first loan with Emprender, and she will use it to purchase more dried peaches for making moconchinchi soft drinks.  She is asking for this loan because she doesn’t have enough money to buy the ingredients she needs.  Jacobina will use her profits to purchase a much larger supply of dried peaches for making moconchinchi, since their cost is about to go up and she wants to have the peaches in bulk so that she won’t have to worry about running out.  Jacobina is very happy to receive this loan and is grateful to Emprender for its support.

loans.use: to purchase dried peaches for making soft drinks.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 49 años de edad, tiene 02  hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Vive en casa propia  con su cónyuge  e hijo en la zona rural del distrito de Motupe, departamento de Lambayeque, cuentan también con el servicio básico de Luz y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de norias artesanales.	

La principal actividad que desarrolla Dora  es la crianza y venta de pavos, patos, gallinas,ovejas y cabritos, donde les alimenta con alimentos balanceados (maìz,polvillo,etc) y cuando alcanzan el tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; esta actividad la realiza desde hace  10  años. Cuentan con clientes  ya establecidos en la zona. 

El monto del  crédito otorgado será  de  S/. 1500 nuevos soles y será para la compra de pavos, patos, gallinas, y de esa manera pueda tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que ella cuenta con clientela ya establecida.
texts.en:
Dora, 49, has two minor children in her care.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and children in Motupe District, Lambayeque Department.  They have electricity and they get their water from artesian wells.

Dora’s main activity is raising turkeys, ducks, chickens, sheep and goats to sell.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed (corn, ‘polvillo’ [made from rice], etc.) and when they reach exact size and weight she sells them to local wholesalers.  She’s been in this line of work for ten years and she has well-established customers in the zone.

The amount of the loan granted will be 1500 new soles to buy turnkeys, ducks and chickens to have better income for her home and thus be able to improve her quality of life.   She doesn’t have much competition in this line of work in the area because she already has a well-established clientele.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive en su propia casa con su esposa, dos hijos y tres nietos, este negocio tiene aproximadamente 12 años de existir, ya cuenta con buen número de clientes.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como papel higiénico, pasta dental, jabón, detergentes, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, y más. Este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar el inventario de la tienda y así mejorara la atención de los clientes manteniendo su fidelidad.
La aspiración de Ramón es crecer en el negocio, ampliar el local donde lo tiene y poder mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Ramón manages a general supply store.  He lives in his own house with his wife, two children, and three grandchildren.  He has had this business for about 12 years now and has a good number of customers.

Ramón is asking for a loan so he can purchase merchandise such as toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, detergent, corn, beans, sugar, oil, and other basic supplies.  This loan will help him increase his shop’s inventory and thus meet his customers’ needs so he can maintain their loyalty.

Ramón’s goals are for his business to grow, to increase the size of his store, and to improve his family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, detergent, corn, and other basic supplies.

loans.name: Edward Abu's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are staff members of a very reputable company in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. This group of colleagues has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city, to apply for a loan. With the help of these loans they are capacitated to do or invest in things that their salaries alone cannot let them do or invest in. 

For example, some will be able to buy pieces of household furniture, house building materials, pay school fees for their children, invest in agriculture or in business, etc. And at the end of each month, their company’s finance officer will repay the loan on their behalf.

Edward is the leader of this team. The forty-five-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school.  Edward has been working for this company for nine years now. He has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. He will use his share of the loan to hire a tractor for ploughing and to buy rice seed to plant on his four-acre plot of land.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for ploughing and to buy rice seed to plant on his four-acre plot of land.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 24-year-old single girl who started working in the art business ten years ago. Sally started her own business with the help of her parents very early. It was her hobby and her parents helped by improving it. At the same time, they helped her to continue her school education and now she is enjoying her graphic design university studies.

Sally draws and paints on glass and she also makes special events souvenirs. She is very talented in her business and all of her customers are happy dealing with her.

Sally is improving her business a lot. That's why she applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary colors and glass necessary for her business, in addition to paying her university educational fees.

Sally's business is inside her parents’ house. She hopes to open her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary colors and glass necessary for her business, in addition to paying her university educational fees.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man and a father of one child. He has worked in construction for 11 years and specializes in gypsum work. It is a very artistic type of work to do. That's why he applied for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools to update his business as much as he can. Ali has been a Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles. His previous loans helped a lot in improving both his social and financial situations.

Ali is working hard to keep his business updated to attract more customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Richelyn

texts.en:
Richelyn is 23 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Richelyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase kilos of fish to sell/retail.

Richelyn has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Richelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of fish to sell/retail.

loans.name: Totemia

texts.en:
Totemia is widowed with four children. Totemia is 67 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Totemia sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000.00 PHP to be used for purchasing additional rice for her retail business.

Totemia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Totemia hopes to expand her business to other areas.

loans.use: to be used for purchasing additional rice for retail.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 28 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child. 

Rolly has a hog fattening business and earns approximately 4,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to be used for purchasing feed for his hog fattening business. 

Rolly has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Rolly hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to be used for purchasing feed for his hog fattening business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 30 años y es casada con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de 8 años, ella tiene una tienda de barrio donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, también se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida su tienda se encuentra en la zona Héroes del Chaco,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María utilizara este préstamo para la compra de una vitrina para exponer sus dulces en su tienda,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar sus ventas. Va a utilizar los beneficios mostrar la variedad de productos al cliente.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 30 years old, married, and has an eight-year-old child. She has a neighborhood store where she offers a variety of basic necessity products. María also prepares and sells food. Her store is located in the District of Héroes del Chaco.

This loan is the first one she has received from Emprender. Sra. María will use this loan to buy a display case for presenting the sweets in her store. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can improve her family's quality of life. María faces challenges in her business, such as trying to improve her sales. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will be able to display a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a display case for her business.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvín, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él es comerciante de ropa, lo aprendió en un comercial donde trabajo anteriormente, su negocio es propio, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para salir a venderla, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar esta compra y a diversificar el negocio, surtiéndolo de nuevas blusas, camisetas, ropa interior, faldas, para salir a vender y atender mejor a sus clientes.
El objetivo de Marvín es crecer con su negocio y a través de este desarrollo poderse construir su vivienda para dales a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Marvín lives with his wife and two children.  He is a clothing merchant.  He learned a lot from a company where he previously worked, and now has his own business.  He works as a street vendor and has a flexible work schedule.

Marvín is asking for a loan so he can purchase clothing to sell.  This loan will allow him to purchase the clothing he needs and diversify his business.  He plans to stock up on new blouses, T-shirts, underwear, and skirts so he can better attend to his customers’ needs.    

Marvín’s goal is for his business to grow, which will enable him to finish building his house and thus provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, T-shirts, underwear, and skirts.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 42 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Fe has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately 3,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used in purchasing additional dried fish to sell. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fe hopes to build her own dried fish stall.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old and lives in Casusan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Marcela works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell. 

Marcela has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Marcela hopes to have her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 30 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Marilou has a motorcab for hire business and earns approximately 3,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more materials for her motorcab for hire. 

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Marilou hopes to buy another motorcab for hire.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her motorcab for hire

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is married with  children. Roberto is 32 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Roberto owns a bakery to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, he earns 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase ingredients and sacks of flour to make bread to sell.

Roberto has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Roberto hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and sacks of flours to make bread to sell.

loans.name: Cenona

texts.en:
Cenona is married with six children. Cenona is 64 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Cenona sells rubber to earn a living and had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase rubber to sell/retail.

Cenona is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Cenona hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rubber to sell/retail.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina is 64 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. 

Ursulina has a dressmaking business and earns approximately 2,500.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing clothes and other sewing accessories for her business. 

Ursulina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Ursulina hopes to establish her own dress shop.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing clothes and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 56 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with seven children. 

Rosie has a hog fattening business and earns approximately 3,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 14,900 PHP to be used for purchasing feed for her hog fattening business. 

Rosie has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Rosie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Kasyula

texts.en:
Kasyula is a divorced woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kasyula has operated a maize selling business for the past 2 years, operating from her home where her neighbors are her potential customers. Before this business, Kasyula depended on subsistence farming as her source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of the commodity. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. His wife, who is a businesswoman, also contributes to the provisions of the family's basic needs. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

James has been a bread supplier to the local kiosks for the past 20 years. Before this business, James was a photographer. He faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he wants to purchase additional stock of bread for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bread for resale.

loans.name: Zilpha

texts.en:
Zilpha is 58 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Zilpha has a grocery store that sells groceries and other consumable goods. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional groceries and other consumable goods for sale.

Zilpha has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Zilpha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable goods for sale

loans.name: Ramonatte

texts.en:
Ramonatte is 38 years old and lives in Colambutan Bajo,Tudela. Ramonatte is married without children. 

To earn a living, Ramonatte has a business selling fish in the local community. Ramonatte earns about 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP)  each month doing this type of work. Ramonatte has requested a loan to purchase additional fishing materials and accessories.

Ramonatte has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Ramonatte would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials and accessories

loans.name: Sanie

texts.en:
Sanie is 55 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Sanie has a snack vending business and earns approximately 1,500.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to be used in purchasing feed for her hog raising activity. 

Sanie has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Sanie hopes to purchase more pigs in the future.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing feed for her hog-raising activity.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is married with six children. Cesaria lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Cesaria has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8500 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Cesaria has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Cesaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a farmer from the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He produces milk and eggs for the local market. He is married with two children, ages 3 and 7 years old. He has been farming for five years.

Dennis has made a loan request for 41,200 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use part of the milk produced to meet his family's daily milk requirements and sell the rest to meet other basic needs. He plans to expand his farm to own five dairy cows. He says dairy animal diseases are his major challenge.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds

loans.name: Ferisina

texts.en:
Ferisina is married with four adult children. She has been in active farming for over 15 years. Her farm produces mainly bananas which she sells to the local market.

Ferisina has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy fertilizer and pay the farmhand working on the farm. She wishes to start an irrigation system in order to expand her acreage for bananas and horticultural farming. Ferisina points to poor local markets and inadequate capital as major challenges.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay farmhands

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Gina has a general store to earn a living. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more stock for her general store.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years. In the future, Gina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, con su esposo y dos hijos, todos trabajan en su casa, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, comenzó por iniciativa propia, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche, con la que elabora los productos derivados, como la cuajada, la mantequilla, requesón, este préstamo le ayudara para tener el efectivo necesario y realizar la compra de su principal material.
La aspiración de María es manejar de la mejor manera el préstamo, crecer en el negocio y vivir en buenas condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her family, with her husband and two children and they all work in her home. María makes her living selling dairy products, which she started upon her own initiative. She works as a street vendor and doesn't have a fixed working schedule. 

She is requesting a loan to buy milk with which she makes dairy products such as curd, butter and cottage cheese. This loan will help her to have the cash needed to buy this main ingredient. María hopes to make the most of this loan to grow in the business and to live in good conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solo sus hijos son dependientes, él se dedica a la agricultura, comenzó por el apoyo que le dio su padre, cuando aún era pequeño, no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar en la tierra.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como el abono, herbicidas y semilla mejorada, este préstamo le permitirá la compra de todos los materiales necesarios para trabajar en su cultivo.
La aspiración de Juan es tener una buena cosecha y poder proveerle a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and his two children, who are still dependent on him.  He makes a living as a farmer.  He began by helping his father when he was still small.  As a farmer he works on the land without having to follow a fixed work schedule.

Juan is currently asking for a loan so he can purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds.  This loan will allow him to purchase all of the supplies he needs for farming.  

Juan’s goals are to have a good harvest and be able to provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is widowed with three children. Aida is 66 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Aida is a farm owner and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 13000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to be used in purchasing fertilizers and sprays for her rice production business activity. 

Aida has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Aida hopes to acquire more rice land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and sprays for her rice production activity

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and lives in Buenavista Pagagadian City Philippines. She is married with three children.

Evelyn has a dress shop and earns approximately 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 45000 PHP to purchase more clothes for her dress shop. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her dress shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her dress shop

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with six children.

Thelma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP)  to purchase more fish to sell.

Thelma is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Thelma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Welita

texts.en:
Welita is 57 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. 

Welita works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 14900 Philippine pesos (PHP) to be used for purchasing additional fishing nets for her fishing activity. 

Welita has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, Welita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is married with ten children. Charlita is 63 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Charlita owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 9 months. Each month she earns 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Charlita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Charlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 38 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

Estela works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan of 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more boxes of fish to sell/retail.

Estela has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Estela hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell/retail

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with five children. Jocelyn is 40 years old and lives in Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jocelyn sells cospachem to earn a living and had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3500 PHP to purchase more cospachems to sell/retail.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cospachems to sell/retail

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with four children. Marilyn lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marilyn sells dresses to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more stock of dresses.

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dresses

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is 35 years old and lives in Macabayo, Jimenez. Marion is married with four children. 

Marion has a general store that sells a variety of products. Marion has had this business for 10 years. Marion requested a loan of 30000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Marion has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Marion hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles ,beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión está formado por 9 socias quienes en su mayoría viven por la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia cuenta con diferentes lugares para apreciar la naturaleza, es de clima frió y su centro parroquial es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo colonial. Nuestras son todas amigas y conocidas, son mujeres de un corazón muy cálido, amables y gentiles, se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales, al comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Francisca, es oriunda de la parroquia de Quingeo y ahora vive más en la ciudad, tiene 49 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 22, 20, 18, 16 y 6 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan  económicamente,  su cuarto hijo estudia en el colegio y su última hija estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María Francisca se dedica a  la agricultura, siembra hortalizas para la venta y cuando le llaman trabaja labrando terrenos ajenos, también cría pollos y cuyes para la venta.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es de comprarse un terreno en la ciudad de Cuenca.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Nueva Ilusión" (New Illusion) consists of nine members, most of whom live in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca. This parish has different places where one can appreciate nature. The weather is cold and the central part of the parish is a mixture of the modern and the colonial. All of the members are friends and acquaintances. These women have warm, friendly, and kind hearts. They engage in agriculture, the raising of animals, and trade. In addition, they have maintained the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Sra. María Francisca. She is a native of the parish of Quingeo but now lives in the city. María Francisca is 49 years old and a single mother of five children (ages 22, 20, 18, 16, and 6). Her first three children work and help out financially. Her fourth child is in high school and the youngest child, a daughter, attends an elementary school in the city. María Francisca does not own a home, so she lives in a rental property.

Doña María Francisca is a farmer who grows vegetables to sell. When her land needs to be tilled, she requests the help of others. María Francisca also raises chickens and guinea pigs to sell. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and feed for her animals. Her goal is to buy a plot la land in the city of Cuenca.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Angelica tiene 35 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el que tiene  3 hijos que son de las edades de 4, 6 y 16, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pan y salteñas en su panadería que se encuentra en la localidad de Monte Grande, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Angelica va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de un horno grande y garrafas para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su  negocio para generar más utilidades, la Sra.
