Angelica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que su producción aumente y por ende las ganancias y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia,  sueña para su negocio es prosperar en el negocio para dejarles algo a sus hijos.
texts.en: Angelica is 35 years old.  She is unmarried and lives with her partner and their 3 children, who are ages 4, 6, and 16.  She makes a living preparing and selling bread and salteñas [empanadas] at her bakery, which is located in the town of Monte Grande.  This is Angelica’s first loan with Emprender, and she will use it to purchase a large oven and gas cylinders for her bakery.  She is asking for this loan so she can grow her business and thus generate more profits.  Angelica’s main challenge in her business is increasing her production, and therefore her earnings as well.  She is going to use her profits to improve her family’s quality of life.  Angelica’s dream is for her business to do well so she can leave something for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a large oven and gas cylinders.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian de 38 años de edad es originario de Teustepe, casado, realizo estudios hasta el tercer grado de primaria, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y trigo, padre de 3 hijos. Inicio su actividad desde hace 26 años, producto de su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido mejorar las condiciones de su casa, comprar accesorios que son necesarios para el hogar, las cosechas han sido  beneficiosas, pues con las ganancias  que ha obtenido puso una pulpería en su domicilio para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar. En la temporada de siembra paga mano de obra ya que no cuenta con apoyo familiar, sus productos después de ser cosechados los comercializa en Managua donde el comercio es amplio. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar la semilla de frijol y los insumos necesarios para la siembra del producto, el estima que el crédito  le ayudara ya que podrá sembrar en el tiempo programado y ampliar el área de siembra del producto,  como planes futuros espera pagar el crédito que invertirá en la cosecha y con las ganancias reforzar la venta  seguir  mejorando la infraestructura de su casa, sus metas próximas es preparar el terreno y comprar la semilla que necesitara para la siguiente siembra de frijol.
texts.en:
38-year-old Julian comes from Teustepe.  He is married and studied up to the third year of his primary education.  He is a farmer by trade and works sowing corn, beans and wheat.  He is the father of three children.  Julian started in his business 26 years ago.  Through his efforts and hard work, he has been able to improve his living conditions and buy necessary items for his home.  His harvests have been beneficial as he has used the profits that he has made to set up a grocery store in his home in order to help toward the household expenses.  During the sowing season, Julian pays laborers because he doesn't have family support.  After he harvests his produce, he sells it in Managua where there is a lot of commerce.

Julian is requesting this loan to buy bean seeds and supplies that he needs for sowing his crops.  He believes that the loan will help him because he will be able to sow his crops at the correct time and expand the area over which he grows his crops.  His future plans are to repay the loan and invest in his harvest.  He will use the profits he makes to strengthen his sales.  Julian also hopes to continue improving the infrastructure of his house.  His immediate goals are to prepare his land and buy the seed that he needs for sowing his beans.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and the supplies he needs to sow his crops

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El Sr. Nicolas  tiene 40 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja con la cual tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 8 y 10, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pan en su panadería que se encuentra en la localidad de Espejo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Nicolas va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de un horno grande  para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su  negocio para generar más utilidades, el Sr. Nicolas enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que su producción aumente y por ende las ganancias y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia,  sueña para su negocio es prosperar en el negocio para dejarles algo a sus hijos.
texts.en: Nicolas is 40 years old.  He is not married but lives with his partner.  The couple have two children who are 8 and 10 years old.  Nicolas' business is baking and selling bread in his bakery which is located in the town of Espejo.  This loan is his first with our institution.  Nicolas will use his loan to buy a larger oven for his business.  His reason for requesting this loan is to expand his business so that he can make more profits.  Nicolas faces challenges in his business such as increasing his production and thereby his profits.  He will use the profits that he makes to improve his family's quality of life.  He hopes to do well in his business so that he has something to leave his children.

loans.use: to buy a larger oven

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Josephine has a hog fattening business and earns approximately 2,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to be used in purchasing feed for her hog fattening business.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Josephine hopes to purchase additional piglets.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog fattening business

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica a la venta de verduras, siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas, él vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 16, 13, 10 y 6 años de edad, todos estudian, él está dedicado a las actividades agrícolas y venta  de verduras, esto lo aprendió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos, inicia desde las 5:00am hasta las 4:00pm desde hace 10 años.
 El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, herbicidas para la siembra de maíz y una tarea de  tomates,  esta compra le ayudara a   tener una mejor cosecha para poder venderla, pues así crecerán sus ingresos, su riesgo es un temporal en época de invierno que puede afectarle con plagas. 
El quiere seguir trabajando y produciendo más, que su negocio crezca, que sea más rentable, para poder ayudar a su familia con más posibilidades estabilizando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos' business is selling vegetables and growing basic grains and vegetables.  He lives with his wife and their four children who are 16, 13, 10 and 6 years old and are all in school.  Carlos farms and sells vegetables.  He learned this business as he needed a source of income.  He starts work at 5.00am and works until 4.00pm.  He has done this for 10 years.  

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and herbicides for his corn crops and a 'tarea' (unit of measurement = 0.155 acres) of tomatoes.  These purchases will help him to enjoy a better harvest that he will be able to sell, increasing his income.  The risk he faces is a storm in the winter which can cause him problems with pests.

Carlos would like to continue working and producing more.  He would like his business to grow and become more profitable so that he can help his family by providing them with more possibilities and stabilize their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and herbicides for his corn crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support his hookah business through buying necessary charcoal, molasses, and an LCD, in addition to extra chairs and tables.

loans.name: Antonia Luisa

texts.es:
Antonia, vive con su familia, sus tres hijos, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, este negocio lo inicio por la ayuda de una amiga, quien le enseño todo el proceso, no tiene un horario establecido y trabaja con sus hijos.
Ella solicita un  préstamo para la compra de maíz, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo,  condimentos, para preparar la venta, este préstamo le ayudara a proporcionarle lo necesario y poder trabajar diario con su negocio.
El objetivo de Antonia es crecer con su negocio, poder tener su casa propia y poder mantener a su familia con todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Antonia is a single mother with three children; they currently live with relatives.  She makes a living selling pupusas [stuffed corn cakes].  She started this business with help from a friend, who taught her the whole process.  She works with her children and does not have a fixed work schedule.

Antonia is asking for a loan so she can purchase corn, oil, pork rinds, fresh cheese, and condiments for making pupusas.  This loan will help her to get all of the supplies she needs so she can continue working in her business.

Antonia’s goal is for her business to grow so she can have a house of her own and be able to provide her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, pork rinds, fresh cheese, and condiments.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married with 9 children. Aida is 54 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Aida sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase feed and piglets.

Aida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Aida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Suleiman has been a painter (mainly doing screen printing for advertisements and dying materials with various colors) for six years. He offers this service to schools, hotels and shops.  He cites seasonality as his major business challenge. 

With the KSHS 30,000 he wants to purchase different color codes of paints for his artwork. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy various color codes of paints for his paiting business

loans.name: Mkala

texts.en:
Mkala is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. His wife is unemployed; therefore, Mkala remains the sole breadwinner. He owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. He cites food and schools fees as his greatest monthly expenses.

Mkala has been selling various types of fish for 17 years, selling in wholesale to fishmongers and hotels. Before this business, Mkala was a fisherman. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He aspires to expand his business and offer employment to the locals.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and lives in Taguima, Tudela. Rosalinda is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Rosalinda has a business selling snacks in the local community. Rosalinda earns about 1500 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Rosalinda has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old and lives in Bliss Cabol-anonan,Tudela. Lolita is widowed with five children. 

Lolita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. Lolita has been doing this for 20 years. Lolita has requested a loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is a single woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. She cites food and schools fees as her greatest monthly expenses.

Meselemani has been a tailor for five years, both in making dresses to sell and mending torn ones at a fee. She faces a major challenge of seasonality as sales are high only during celebrations. She aspires to expand her business and offer employment to the community, especially for girls.

With the KSHS 40,000 she wants to purchase clothing materials to make dresses to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials for making dresses to sell

loans.name: Robin

texts.en:
Robin is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya and has been in the farming business for seven years. His farm produces milk, vegetables, and maize, which are all sold within the local market. He is married with four children aged between ten and two years.

Robin has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He earns some additional income from fish farming. He plans to start a transport business to ease his cost of delivery to the local market.

He says his challenge in farming is the fluctuation in milk prices and occasional drought.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Inocente

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el comenzó muy joven el negocio, por iniciativa propia, trabaja desde su casa, no tiene un horario establecido.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semillas crudas, para luego asarlas y ponerlas a la venta, comprara 50 medidas del producto, esta compra le ayudara para crecer con el negocio y tener suficiente cantidad para trabajar y atender a los clientes.
La aspiración de José es tener el negocio mas amplio, con la ayuda de estos prestamos, asi mismo espera tener la solvencia para cancelar las cuotas y seguir trabajando por su familia.
texts.en:
José's business is selling cashew nuts.  He lives with his two children and his wife.  He started his business when he was very young, on his own initiative.  He works from home and does not work fixed hours.  

José is requesting a loan to buy raw cashews which he will then roast and sell.  He will buy 50 units of this product.  This purchase will help him to grow in his business and have a large enough quantity with which to work and serve his customers.

José's aspiration is to expand his business with the help of these loans.  He hopes to be able to meet his repayments and continue working for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw cashew nuts

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is forty-seven years old and is in the farming business in her home of Kitale in Western Kenya. She is married and has four children aged between twenty-three and 19 years. Her farm usually produces milk and maize, part of which are sold to the local market to meet the family's needs.

Christine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She remains confident she will be able to improve her family's living standards and educate her children. She aspires to own at least 20,000 birds.

She is worried about the high costs of feed in the local market. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a father of four children aged between fifteen and six years. He has been in the farming business for more than fifteen years. His farm produces maize.

Benjamin has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and venture into the poultry farming business. He will use the income to meet his family's needs. This is his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo.

His challenge, however, remains animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
Don José tiene 49 años de edad es casado y tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, hojalatería y a la carpintería. Con sus padres aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura, el oficio de hojalatero (elaborar silos metálicos, canales, cubetas, valdes) lo aprendió en una capacitación que duro una semana, ya tiene 5 años de realizar este oficio y la carpintería lo aprendió por su propia cuenta elaborando pequeños  muebles para su casa, y lo desempeña desde hace 10 años. En el trabajo de hojalatero él no compra los materiales, sino que trabaja en pequeños proyectos con Instituciones; para prestar sus  servicios camina a pie durante treinta minutos a pie en una calle rustica, para abordar un autobús que tarda unas tres horas, luego se traslada en un taxi que lo conduce al lugar donde prestara sus servicios.

Los productos agrícolas los compra en una ciudad que esta a treinta y cinco minutos de su casa y el producto lo traslada en su espalda caminando.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 5 sacos de sulfato, 3 sacos de formula, herbecidas, fungicidas y pago de mano de obra para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y maicillo. Él desea brindarles educación a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old, he is married and has three children. He works in agriculture, tin-smithery and carpentry. He learnt the ropes of being a farmer with his parents, and as for the tin smithery (making metal silos, channels, vats and buckets), he learnt this profession during a one week training course and he has been working in this field for five years now. José learned the trade of carpentry on his own, producing small furniture for his home which he has been doing for some 10 years. 

In his work as a tinsmith, he doesn't buy the materials, instead he works on small projects with Instituciones. To offer his services, he walks for 30 minutes to a rural street in order to  take a bus which lasts three hours, he then takes a take to the place where he will offer his services.  

José buys the agricultural products in a city 35 minutes away from his home and he carries the products on his back by foot.

The loan he is requesting is to buy 5 bags of fertilizers, 3 bags of formula, weed-killers and fungicides and to pay workers to farm 14,000 square meters of corn and sorghum. José wants to give his children an education so that they can become professional workers.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of fertilizers, 3 bags of formula, weed-killers, fungicides and pay workers to farm 14,000 square meters of corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Belia Yesenia

texts.es:
Belia tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive con ellos y su abuela en el municipio de La Lima, Cortes
La actividad económica a que se dedica Doña Belia es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios (arroz, pastas, carnes, embutidos, harina, refrescos, verduras, frijoles, papas, pan, medicinas). Inicio su negocio con capital propio,  posteriormente con las ganancias logro aumentar su inventario. Ella cuenta en la actualidad con una clientela fija, lo que le permite un aumento en sus ventas y además la demanda de mayor oferta de productos. 
Actualmente ha solicitado su cuarto préstamo de 20000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de maíz, azúcar, aceite de cocinar,  medicinas, y otra parte para la reparación de un frízer(congelador). Y darle un mejor servicio a los clientes vendiendo productos de excelente calidad.
Su sueño es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias crecer económicamente para apoyar a sus hijos en la educación y lograr un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Belia, age 38, is the single mother of two children.  She lives with them and her grandmother in the La Lima municipality, Cortes.

Belia’s business activity is a grocery store where she sells food products (rice, pasta, meat, sausages, flour, soft drinks, vegetables, beans, potatoes, bread, and medicine).  She started her business with her own capital.  Later, she managed to increase her inventory by using her earnings.

She now has a fixed clientele, which enables her to have an increase in her sales.  Also, the demand for a greater supply of products has increased.  

She has currently requested her fourth loan for 20,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy corn, sugar, cooking oil, and medicine.  She will use the other part to repair a freezer.  This way she will give her customers better service by selling excellent quality products.

Her dream is to increase sales and to use the earnings to grow financially.  She will do this to support her children’s education and to attain a stable business.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, cooking oil, and medicine.  She will use the other part of the loan to repair a freezer.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
Abrahan, se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos básicos y hortalizas, él vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 14, 13, 09 y 6 años de edad, todos estudian, él está dedicado a las actividades agrícolas y venta  de verduras, esto lo aprendió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos. El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, herbicidas para la siembra de dos tareas de  tomates, ejotes y chiles,  esta compra le permitirá  tener una mejora cosecha para poder venderla, pues así crecerán sus ingresos, su riesgo es un temporal en época de invierno que puede afectarle con plagas. 
El quiere seguir trabajando y produciendo más, que su negocio crezca, que sea más rentable, para poder ayudar a su familia con mas posibilidades, dándoles el sustento diario, apoyando a sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Abrahan makes a living selling vegetables and staple grains.  He lives with his wife and their four children, ages 14, 13, 9, and 6; all of his children are in school.  He grows and sells his produce, which is an activity he learned because he needed a source of income.  Abrahan is asking for a loan so he can purchase supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides for planting two crops of tomatoes, green beans, and chili peppers.  These supplies will improve his harvest so he can sell more produce, which will increase his income.  One of the risks he faces is storms in the winter, which could encourage pests.     

Abrahan wants to keep working and producing more, because as his business grows it will become more profitable.  This will enable him to help his family by providing them with more opportunities, giving them a means of support, and for his children, supporting their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides for growing tomatoes, green beans, and chili peppers.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José,  vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos, el oficio de José es la agricultura,  comenzó desde joven, por iniciativa propia, trabaja solo, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él solicita un préstamo porque está iniciando su cultivo agrícola, necesita la compra de insumos como el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, que son necesarios para realizar esta labor, esta compra le permitirá aplicar los insumos necesarios para que su siembra le dé buena cosecha. 
El objetivo de José es tener su propia casa, crecer en la agricultura y poder proveer a su familia mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
José lives with his family: his wife and three children.  His business is farming.  He started working at a young age, on his own initiative, and works alone.  He does not work fixed hours.

José is requesting a loan because he is starting to sow his crops.  He needs to buy supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides that he needs in order to carry out this work.  This purchase will allow him to make use of these necessary supplies so that he enjoys a good harvest.

José's goal is to own his own home, to grow in his farming business, and to be able to provide his family with more stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Cécile's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Cécile est responsable du groupe de deux personnes. Elle a un enfant de moins de trois ans. Cécile s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers et ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes, en générale les détaillants. Cécile fait ses achats sur l'un des marchés de la place et envisage avoir assez de bénéfice. Dans ce besoin d'agrandir son commerce, Cécile a sollicité, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Cécile, age 32, is the representative of a group which consists of two people.  She has one child under the age of three. 

Cécile is specialized in the sale of various products, and her customer base consists of both men and women, usually retailers.  She buys her goods at one of the local markets and she would like to increase her profits. 

As she would like to expand her business, Cécile has requested a micro-loan from Finadev, along with the other member of her group.  In the photo, Cécile is featured on the left.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of powdered milk, 1 box of condensed milk, 1 box of sugar, 1 box of spaghetti and 1 box of sardines.

loans.name: Ermelinda Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ermelinda tiene 61 años de edad es casado y tiene siete hijos, todos mayores de edad. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas, ya que su esposo tiene una discapacidad y a ella le corresponde realizar el trabajo. Además, todos los días sale a vender de manera ambulante en el mismo lugar donde vive tamales, pastelitos, yuca y algunas veces fruta embolsada. Ella se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. y termina su jornada hasta las 9:00 p.m., también realiza sus oficios domésticos. 

Los insumos agrícolas los compra en una ciudad que esta a seis kilómetros de la comunidad,  debido a esto paga un vehiculo para que la traslade a realizar sus compras.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes, 50 libras de semilla hibrida y pago de mano de obra.  De esta manera ella comprara todo de una sola vez para pagar transporte de igual manera y aplicara todo los insumos en el tiempo necesario a sus cultivos. Al mejorar sus cultivos, también mejorara sus ganancias. La señora Ermelinda desea contar con la posibilidad de brindarle una mejor vida a su esposo que tiene incapacidad.
texts.en:
Ermelinda, age 61, is married and has seven grown children.  She has been devoting herself to agricultural work for 20 years.  This is because her husband has a disability, and it falls to her to do the work. 

Also, she goes out to sell in an itinerant manner in the same place where she lives.  She sells tamales, pastries, yucca, and sometimes bagged fruit.  She gets up at 4:00 a.m. and finishes her working day as late as 9:00 p.m.  She also does the household chores.

She buys the agricultural supplies in a city that is six kilometers from her community.   This is why she pays for a vehicle to take her to make her purchases.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer, 50 pounds of hybrid seeds, and to pay for labor.  This way she will buy everything at one time, and she will only have to pay for transportation one time.  She will use all of the supplies for her crops at the necessary time.

Upon improving her crops, her income will also improve.  Ermelinda wishes to have the chance to give her disabled husband a better life.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer, 50 pounds of hybrid seeds, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Leonila's Group

texts.en:
Leonila is married with 2 children. Leonila is 59 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Leonila sells cacao bar tabliya (unsweetened chocolate) to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 10,000.00 to be used in purchasing additional cacao seeds for her tabliya-making business.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Leonila hopes to build a store. Leonila is the leader of a 3 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cacao seeds to make tabliya (unsweetened chocolate) to sell.

loans.name: Oprecida

texts.en:
Oprecida is single, 55 years old, and lives in San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Oprecida sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 12,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase piglets.

Oprecida has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Justine Laure's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composée de deux personnes. La représentante du nom de Justine Laure est âgée de 52 ans. Justine Laure est mariée et a deux enfants. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, Justine Laure mène comme activité la vente de pure water qu'elle réalise elle-même à domicile. Elle a l'habitude de les distribuer  à ses clients déjà ciblés pour la vente. En vue d'améliorer le niveau de vie de leurs enfants et d'agrandir leur commerce, Justine Laure a sollicité, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This group consists of two women.  The group's representative, Justine Laure, is 52 years old.  She is married and has two children.

In order to cope with her daily expenses, Justine Laure sells Pur water.  She works alone and sells directly from home.  She is used to distributing her goods to a targeted customer base. 

In order to improve their children's living conditions and to expand their businesses, Justine Laure and the other member of the group have requested a micro-loan from Finadev.  Justine Laure is the woman featured on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of Pur water packets.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is thirty-six and a mother of four children, who are aged between fourteen and nine years. She has been active in farming for seven solid years and sells her produce to the local markets. Her farm produces milk, vegetables, eggs, and maize.

Lydiah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry for a boost in her poultry business. She says the business has prospects for growth, owing to the ready market for poultry products. She is planning to run a farm of no less than two thousand birds. She says she will also boost her family's living standards.

Her major challenges remain the high-cost of feed and poultry diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 35 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. 

Merlyn has a grocery store that sells groceries and other products. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC since this year.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 35 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has four children. 

Fortunata has a grocery store that sells groceries and other products. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more items for her grocery store

Fortunata has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Fortunata hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her grocery store

loans.name: Fedman

texts.en:
Fedman is 22 years old and is a married man with a 4-month-old child. He lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with his family. 

Fedman provides repair services for radios and televisions to his community. He requested a loan to purchase tools and other materials. 

Fedman hopes to venture into a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tools and other materials.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married and has six children. She is 53 years old and lives in Molos, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lilia sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and piglets to sell.

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with two children aged 13 and 15. Her husband is a carpenter.

Merlita buys scrap that she resells for a profit. She works hard to help supplement the family income. She applied for a loan to buy more scrap to sell. 

Merlita hopes her business will grow. She also hopes to sustain her children's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.name: Rogaciana

texts.en:
Rogaciana is 42 years old. She is a married woman with five children aged between 8 and 19 years. Her husband is a farmer.

Rogaciana buys and resells coconuts to her community. She also raises pigs to augment her income. Rogaciana has requested a loan to purchase feed and more coconuts to sell. She hopes to earn more and to be able to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase feed and more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has five children.  She practices dairy farming to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 12 years. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested a loan for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has three children.  She practices farming to earn a living.  She mainly grows mushrooms in her farm.  She has been in the business for only one year.  She also does dairy farming to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested a loan for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy mushroom seedlings.

loans.use: To buy mushroom seedlings

loans.name: Blecila

texts.en: Blecila is a married woman with a 15-year-old child. Her husband is a fisherman. She has had a sari-sari store for five years. She sells items like coffee, sugar, juice, and canned goods. Blecila's income goes to her family's basic needs and school expenses. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. Blecila hopes to increase her sales and business profitability.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has three children.  She practices farming to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  She employes one person in her business.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested a loan for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a cow and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a cow and animal feed

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 41 years old, is married and has four children. She practices dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for over ten years. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. She has requested 45,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.ru: Dilara vedet selskoxozaystvennoe delo okolo 25 let, ey pomogaet ee semya. Ona prodayet molochnie produkti na mestnom rinke. Dilare 53 goda, ona jivet s mujem i 3 detmi. Obratilas ona za summoy v 700 AZN dla togo chtobi sdelat remont doma, etot kredit pomojet ey soxranit i rasshirit doxodi s biznesa. Ee drujelubnost pomogaet ey rabotat, Dilara zarane blagodarna za pomosh.
texts.en:
Dilara has been leading an agricultural business for almost 25 years and she sells dairy products at the local market.  Her family helps her with this business.  
Dilara is 53 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children.  She has requested a loan of 700 AZN in order to repair her house.  This loan will help her to maintain and increase the level of income she gets from her business.  Dilara's kindness is her biggest asset in her work.  She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and has five children. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She also does dairy farming to supplement her income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because has been trained in business management skills.

She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. She has requested for 50000 KES to buy chicks and chick mash.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chick mash.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 64 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. 

Fe has a general store. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more items for her general store.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her general store

loans.name: Precillar

texts.en:
Precillar is a single mother of one child.  She sells honey to earn a living.  She has been in this business for more than ten years.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya, because has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ some people.  She has requested a loan for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to add to her honey stock.

loans.use: To add to her honey stock

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married and has three children. Norma is 36 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Norma runs a clothing business. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000. Norma has been a member of PMPC since 2012.

In the future, Norma hopes to open a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Enesencia

texts.en:
Enesencia is 60 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has six children.
 
Enesencia has a grocery store that sells groceries and other products. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more items for her grocery store.

Enesencia has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years.  In the future, Enesencia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her grocery store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia used her previous loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, flour, rice, and soap.  With the additional stock, she was able to make more profit. She used the additional income from her business to renovate her rental houses. She has requested another loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings to add to her stock of cereals, sugar, cooking fat, and soap.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cereals, sugar, cooking fat, and soap.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 46 years old and lives in the town of Getafe, Bohol with her family. She runs a sari-sari store where she sells various items like detergent, eggs, snack foods, and canned goods. She is able to provide for her family's daily needs with her income. She hopes to earn more and save more. She has requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, toiletries, and rice. This will help to increase Lucia's sales and profitability.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell such as canned goods, toiletries, and rice

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca  tiene 45 años y es casada con un hijo que tiene la edad de seis años, ella se dedica a la venta de Tucumanas y salteñas que se encuentran en la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Francisca va a utilizar este préstamo  para compra de un horno para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Francisca enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran cantidad de competencia en el mercado, Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en tener otro puesto de venta,  sueña para su negocio es tener muchas tiendas de venta de tucumanas y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 45 years old and married, with 1 son who is 6 years old. She sells “tucumanas” [stuffed buns, similar to “empanadas”] and “saltenas” [meat pies] in the zone of Pampahasi. This is her 1st loan cycle with this Institution. Francisca will use the loan to buy an oven for her business. Her reason for soliciting the loan is her lack of working capital. 

Francisca confronts challenges in her business, especially the large number of competitors in the market. She will utilize the benefits to establish another sales post. Her dream for her business is to have many stalls selling “tucumanes” and thus, in this way, to improve her income and, consequently, her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an oven for baking local dishes to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 33 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has three children. 

Romeo works in the fish industry by catching and selling fish for a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional fishing nets. 

Romeo has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Romeo hopes to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio is 57 years old. He is a married man with 7 children aged between 12 and 30 years. He is a fisherman and supports his family through fishing. Dionesio would like his income to improve so he can sustain his family and his children's education. He has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and crab traps. This will help bring in more fish and crabs to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and crab traps

loans.name: Merlyn's Group

texts.en:
Merlyn is 31 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child. 

Merlyn has a hog fattening business, and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase feeds for her hog fattening business. 

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, she hopes to purchase additional piglets.  Merlyn is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her hog fattening business

loans.name: Edmer

texts.en: Edmer is 31 years old. He is a married man with 4 children aged between 2 and 11 years. He is a fisherman from Getafe, Bohol. Edmer provides for his family through fishing. He works hard to increase his earnings and to be able to sustain his children's education. He has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, floaters, and lead weights. Edmer hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, floaters, and lead weights

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a married woman. She has a daughter who is 2 years old. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as flour, beans, soap, toothbrushes, painkillers, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fast-growing town, and her primary customers are residents of the town and its environs. Jacinta describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products. Her business goal is to run another retail shop within the nearby town within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will use the generated profits to expand her retail shop and to buy some land.

loans.use: to add more home products to her inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add to her stock of clothes. She made good sales and hence more profits from her business.  She was able to pay her children's school fees with the additional profits. She hopes to grow her business in the future. Esther has requested another loan, in the amount of 14,900 Kenyan shillings, to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá Group

texts.es:
Doña Julia es una más de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá, tiene 32 años y es madre soltera de 3 niños, no cuenta con ayuda del padre. Por eso debe trabajar mucho para llevar el  sustento a su familia. La actividad que realiza Julia es la cria y venta de cerdos, que comercializa en la misma comunidad. 
Este es el tercer crédito que solicita, y está muy agradecida con la oportunidad que le han  brindado para invertir en capital de trabajo.  
En el grupo con Doña Julia hay 4 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal  Banco Mujer Jehova Proveera. She is 32 years old and the single mother of 3 children. She can't count on aid from the father. For that reason, she has to work hard to provide sustenance for her family. Julia's economic activity involves raising and selling pigs, which she does in her community. 

Julia is requesting her 3rd loan and she is very grateful for the opportunity offered to invest more capital in her work.

In the group picture with Julia are 4 other members who also plan to invest in farming activities.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en:
Quirino is 62 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has three children. 

Quirino has a grocery store that sells groceries and other products. He has had this business for 10 years. He has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional groceries to sell.

Quirino has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Quirino hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina is 27 years old, and she is a married woman with 3 children, ages 3, 5, and 9. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Edwina sells her husband's catch at the market. She says that their income from fishing is used for the family's basic needs and there is usually nothing left to reinvest in the business. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials such as fish nets and weights. Edwina hopes that this loan will help increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as fish nets and weights

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is married and has six children. She sells charcoal to earn a living, and she has been in the business for four years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained in business management skills.  

Consolata hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add to her stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To add to her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en: Imelda is 45 years old and married with 1 adult child and 2 school-aged children. Imelda has been operating a small jewelry shop for almost 7 years. She earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more jewelry for her retail business. Imelda hopes to expand her business after 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry for her retail business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has four children. She earns a living from her rental houses, and she has been in the business for seven years. She also does farming to supplement her income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mercy has grown her business because she has been trained in business management skills.  
She hopes to build more rental houses in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate rental her houses.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is married and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living, and she has been in the business for seven years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Jackline hopes to grow her business and open other outlets in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 47 años de edad es originario de Granada, soltero, padre de 4 hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 25 años actividad que empezó por medio de su primer trabajo ya que el es retirado del servicio militar y de lo que logro ahorrar de su trabajo consiguió un tramo en el mercado donde decidió poner una puesto de venta de verduras desde entonces ha sacado este negocio adelante con capital propio, anteriormente también tenia una venta de fritanga pero decidió quitarla porque no le generaba muchas ganancias para mantener a su familia, Cuenta  con otros ingresos  provenientes del negocio de alquiler de cuartos. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar sacos de papas y cebollas los producto que le hace falta tener en existencia en su puesto de venta, el estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que invertirá en su negocio para mejorar y surtir   de los productos que le demanden  sus clientes, sus planes futuros es mejorar su casa  de habitación con los ingresos que le genere el negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is 47 years old and is a native of Granada. He is single and the father of 4 children, which are in his charge. A merchant by trade, he has worked in the sale of vegetables for 25 years. He started this business through his first job. Now that he is retired from military service, and from what he was able to save from his work, he attained a section in the market where he decided to set up a place to sell vegetables. Since then he has brought this business ahead with his own capital. Before, he also sold fried food but decided to stop because it didn't generate many profits to support his family. The business of renting rooms is another source of income.

He requests the loan to buy sacks of potatoes and onions, the products that he lacks in his sales booth. He values that the loan will help him, since he will invest it in his business to improve and supply the products that are in demand with his clients.  His future plans are to improve his home with the profits that the business generates.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La señora Laura oriunda de la localidad de San Jose vive en la casa de sus padres, tiene 49 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 19 y 21 años, su actividad es la venta de refrigerios y sándwich en el colegio de la zona,  convive con el sr. José el cual es albañil tienen, la Sra. Laura se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para elaborar sus sándwich y también para prepara el almuerzo para su familia, después sale a vender todo esto por la mañana, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Laura comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus refrigerios, la Sra. Laura es una persona responsable y trabajadora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir adelante superándose.
texts.en:
Laura, a native of San Jose, lives in her parent's home.  She is 49 years old and she has two children that are 19 and 21 years old.  She sells snacks and sandwiches in the region's school.  She lives with José who is a bricklayer.

Laura gets up in the early morning hours to prepare the sandwiches and also to prepare lunch for her family.  Afterward, she leaves her home to make her morning sales.

With this loan, Laura will buy ingredients for the preparation of her snacks.  Laura is a very responsible person and she is grateful to work with this institution because of its economic support, which enables her to have a better quality of life and to continue working to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of snacks

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 39 años, es soltera, pero está al cuidado de sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. La casa donde viven es propia.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de comestibles (verduras, arroz, especias, azúcar, entre otros) en un espacio que implementó en su casa. Este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 6 años, pero empezó a realizarlo con más ahínco cuando su ex esposo dejó de apoyarlos económicamente. Pero ella pudo salir adelante sola, con sus hijos, gracias a este negocio. Normalmente lo atiende sola, pero cuando sus hijos se desocupan de la escuela la apoyan con los deberes del hogar. 
Con el tiempo desea ampliar su negocio, con ventas al por mayor, pero por el momento su prioridad es comprar mercadería para su puesto de venta.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con los cronogramas de pago. De igual forma, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por ser personas solidarias y responsables. 
Con los 2,500 nuevos que ahora solicita se abastecerá de mercadería para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Irene, age 39, is single and cares for her three children. She wants to provide them with a better quality of life. Irene owns the house in which they live.

Her business involves selling groceries (vegetables, rice, spices, sugar, and other products) from a space established inside of her home. She has been in this business for six years. Irene began working diligently when she realized her ex-husband had stopped providing financial support. However, she has been able to press forward by herself, along with her children, thanks to this business. Normally she works alone, but when her children are not busy with school, they help with the household chores. Over time, she wants to expand her business and generate more sales. At the moment, her priority is buying merchandise for her shop.

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. In addition, she appreciates that the members of her Communal Bank are supportive and responsible people. The loan of 2,500 PEN that she is requesting now will be used to restock her store with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sandra Alina

texts.es: Sandra es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 46 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropas por catálogo y también trabaja en un cuna jardín. Se siente feliz y orgullosa de todo lo que ha aprendido en la Institución y agradecida por las facilidades de crédito que le brindan. Le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que ellas la motivaron a seguir adelante. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos así como para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the communal bank Buena Suerte. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 10 years.  She works in the sale of cosmetics and clothing by catalogue and also works in a nursery school. 

She is happy and proud of everything she has learned in the Institution and thankful for the ease that the loans offer. She likes the trainings she receives in her communal bank a lot since they motivate her to get ahead.  She will invest the new loan that she requests to buy cosmetics as well as for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics as well as for the education of her children.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es: Melchora es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años. Es dueña de talleres de artesanía de tejidos y bordados. Se siente exitosa con todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros los cuales la ayudaron para la educación de sus hijos y para la construcción de su vivienda. Las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le enseñaron mucho a trabajar y a ser una mujer emprendedora. Agradece a la Institución por las facilidades de crédito que le brindan. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como hilos y lana así como para el pago de sus operarios.
texts.en:
Melchora is a member of the Communal Bank "Buena Suerte" (Good Luck). She is 65 years old, married, and has three children. Melchora has been with FINCA Peru for 15 years. She is the owner of handicraft workshop that produces woven and embroidered goods. Melchora feels successful with everything she has accomplished as a result of her savings, which helped her provide an education for her children and pay for the construction of her home. The training classes offered by her Communal bank have taught her a great deal about working and becoming a female entrepreneur. She is grateful to FINCA for the credit services it has provided.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies, such as thread and wool, and to pay her workers.

loans.use: to buy thread and wool and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Dominga Lucia

texts.es: Dominga Lucia tiene su negocio que es la venta y elaboración de comida, Todos los días trabaja ya que siempre le ha gustado ser trabajar e independiente s económicamente con esta herramienta de trabajo  logro formar a sus hijos con mucho empeño y dedicación, gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado, El crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, platos, cubiertos y bolsas, arroz, frijoles, tomates.
texts.en:
Dominga Lucia has a business that involves preparing and selling food. She does this every day because she always enjoys working and being financially independent. By having this source of work, she is able to bring up her children with great effort and dedication thanks to the support Fundación León 2000 has provided.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, vegetables, plates, cutlery, bags, rice, beans, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, plates, cutlery, bags, rice, beans, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 54 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with 5 children. 

Arsenia has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of PHP 7000  to be used for purchasing feeds for her hog fattening business.
 
Arsenia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Arsenia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Elvira's Group

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

Elvira has a grocery store that sells groceries and other consumable goods and a barbecue stand. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 4000 to purchase additional groceries, consumable goods for sale and meat for her barbecue business.

Elvira has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.  In the future, Elvira hopes to expand her business. Elvira is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for sale and meats for barbecue.

loans.name: Hofe Margarita

texts.es: Hofe tiene 47 años y vive en Guayaquil. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes y carne de chancho. la tienda la maneja ella ya que tiene una niña especial y se le facilita poderla cuidar. Le va bien ya que en su sector no hay tiendas cercas. Su día es muy atareado ya que empieza desde las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche. Su esposo Vicente maneja la venta de carne de chancho. Tiene 4 hijos, pero 2 de ellos ya son mayores de edad. A su cargo tienen 1 niño que asiste a la escuela y la nena especial. Con el crédito comprara víveres, vitrina y percha. Su meta es mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Hofe is 47 years old and lives in Guayaquil. She has a grocery store and sells pork. Hofe opened this store because she has a daughter with special needs and this business enables her to care for her. She is doing very well because there are no other stores nearby in her area. Her day is very busy since she starts at 6am and does not finish until 9pm. Her husband Vicente handles the selling of the pork. Hofe has four children, but two of them are already grown. She still looks after a son who attends school and her daughter with special needs.

With this loan, Hofe will be able to buy provisions, a display case, and shelving. Her goal is to make improvements to her home and expand her business so that her finances will be in better shape.

loans.use: to buy provisions, a display case, and shelving.

loans.name: Azimkan

texts.ru:
Азимкан 32 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей.  В этом году, учитывая отсутствие магазинов с промышленными товарами, Азимкан начала свой бизнес в торговле автомобильными запчастями, стартовав с суммы 70,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Азимкан, на сегодня ее ежмесячная прибыль составляет 5,000 сом (KGS).
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азимкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Азимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Azimkan is 32 years old, married, and is raising 2 children. This year, having noticed the lack of local suppliers, Azimkan launched her own business selling automotive parts with a starting sum of 70,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Azimkan's monthly profits currently amount to 5,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, Azimkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to expand the range of her products. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of auto parts in her shop

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is a 26-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol. He has no children yet but hopes to have one soon.

He sells electronic accessories to his community and has had this business for three years. Gerard requested a loan because he needs additional capital. He plans to buy more electronic accessories to sell. Gerard hopes his sales and profitability will increase.

loans.use: to buy more electronic accessories to sell.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 57 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 10 children.
To earn a living, Anastacia has a business selling a variety of foods. She earns about 2,000PHP each month doing this type of work. Anastacia has requested a loan for additional capital.
Anastacia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Anastacia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Brown

texts.en: Brown is a 39 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. He describes himself as humble and God-fearing. He operates a carpentry shop where he sells furniture such as sofa sets, beds, cupboards, tables etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a busy estate and his primary customers are residents of a nearby fast growing busy estate. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of wood. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy trees for wood. Patrick had taken loan of Kes 30,000 as his first loan which he managed to repay well. His business goal is to operate a permanent business premises within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the profits generated to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy trees for wood to be used for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира 1986 года рождения.Она не замужем и живет с матерью,росла без отца.Так как матери одной очень трудно она не сидит сложа руки и работает в Университете лаборанткой.Дополнительно она с матерью занимаются откормом скота на даче. Продают молоко и молочные продукты. Основные их потребители являются соседи.В связи с тем что их квартира нуждается в обновлении Мохира на получйенны кредит хочет отремонтировать  квартиру.Она заренее благодорит нашу организацыю.
texts.en: Mohira was born in 1986. She is single and lives with her mother, having grown up without a father. Since it's difficult for her mother to make ends meet alone, Mohira doesn't stay idle and works as a lab assistant at the university. Additionally, she and her mother keep livestock at their dacha and sell milk and dairy products. Their main customers are their nieghbours. As their apartment is in need of repairs, Mohira would like to use this loan to improve their living conditions. She thanks MDO Arvand, LLC in advance.

loans.use: to repair her apartment

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.ru: Мохинисо,38-летняя женщина, мать двоих детей, которая занимается продажей мелкого товара для домашнего обихода, и хозяйственных товаров. Она этим видом деятельности  занимается уже семь лет. В основном она ездит на рынки по районам Лохути,и Ниёзбек, два раза в неделю.А в выходные дни она торгует на городском рынке Костакоза, и товар привозит из Худжанда , а также закупает у фирм. Для увеличения активов, а также для увеличения разнообразия ассортимента она решила получить кредит.
texts.en: Mohiniso is 38 years old and a mother of two. She has been selling small household goods and decorations for the past seven years. Mainly, she travels to the markets in the Lohuti and Niezbek regions twice per week, and trades at the Kostakos city market on weekends. Mohiniso purchases her products in Khujand and also directly from suppliers. She has decided to request a loan in order to increase her working capital and to expand the assortment of her products.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of her products and expand her business

loans.name: Cuautomatitla Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes son la señora Nicolasa va a comprar con su prestamo flores, la señora Virginia va a comprar carnes frias, refrescos, mayonesa, la señora Roberta va a comprar peras y aguate, la señora Sahara va a compra azucar, aceite y refrescos, los otros integrantes siguen en la actividad que vienen desarrollando.  La señora Josefa tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene 7 hijos, 4 mujeres y 3 varones los hombres son casados, estan estudiando 3 niñas una la primaria, otra la secundaria y la pequeña preescolar, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar mercancías como azúcar, aceite, arroz, huevo, refrescos, sabritas, jabón, escobas, etc. Ella inicio su negocio hace 14 años, por necesidad, para ganar más, ella inicio con poquito vendiendo refrescos y pan y fue subiendo poco a poco, su negocio es importante  porque le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, a ella le gusta vender atender amablemente a sus clientes para que regresen a su negocio, ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir y para los gastos de sus hijas que están estudiando, ella está feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes y así dar mejor servicio al cliente. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener otro negocio de ropa y que sus hijos también logren tener su propio negocio. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por confiar en nosotros ya que sin conocernos nos prestan, gracias a ustedes logramos crecer los negocios y vivir mejor con la familia".
texts.en: The new members are Nicolasa, who is going to buy flowers with her loan, Virginia, who is going to buy cold cuts, beverages, and mayonnaise,  Roberta, who is going to buy pears and avocados, and Sahara, who is going to buy sugar, oil and beverages. The other members continue in the activities that they have been doing.  Josefa is 44 years old, married and has 7 children, 4 girls and 3 boys. Her sons are married and 1 of her daughters is in preschool, another in elementary school and the another in high school. She has a small grocery store and has asked for her loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, oil, rice, eggs, beverages, chips, soap, brooms, etc. She started her business 14 years ago out of necessity, to make more money. She started small selling a few beverages and bread and grew little by little. Her business is important because it helps with the household expenses. She is proud to have her own business and she likes to sell, serving her customers in a friendly way so they return to her business. She uses the earnings to re-invest and for the expenses for her daughters who are in school. She is happy with the loan that she is going to receive and she is going to buy merchandise for her small grocery store so she can offer better service to her customers. Her hopes and dreams are to have another business selling clothes and for her children to have their own business as well. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad “we thank you for trusting us, since without knowning us you lend to us. Thanks to you we have been able to make our businesses grow and live better with our families."

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, rice, eggs, beverages, soups, chips, soap, shampoo, toilet paper.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Марие 39 лет, вдова. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года Мария занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 12,000 сом (KGS), Мария добилась успехов -  сегодня ее хозяйство приносит около 20,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мария обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Мария планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Mariya is a 39-year-old widow. In order to provide a source of income for her family, she has been keeping cattle since 1995. Having started her business with 12,000 som (KSG), Mariya has achieved great success, and presently her farm earns roughly 20,000 som per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Mariya has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase more cattle. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mauricio Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Mauricio es una persona muy trabajara, con muchas ganas de superación este hombre cuenta con una su actividad económica que es operario o guarda del cementerio ubicado en la localidad de su comunidad este emprendedor está solicitando un financiamiento  para la hacerle mejoras a su casa como es la construcción de una pared componer una puerta hacer un embaldosado en el patio, esto solo lo consigue gracia al financiamiento que fundación le ha podido brindar.
texts.en: Mauricio is a very hardwoking person who really wants to get ahead. This man has an economic activity which is a guard located at a cementery located in his community. This entrepreneur is asking for a loan to do some home improvements, such as build a wall, fix a door, and put in a floor in the patio. He is only able to do this thanks to the loan that the foundation has offered him.

loans.use: to pay for:  home improvement

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru:
Надире 24 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Надира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2005 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Надиры на сегодняшний  день имеется  10 овец, 2 коровы с телятами, что приносит ей около 15,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Надира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Надира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nadira is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children. As the main source of income for her family, Nadira has been raising livestock since 2005, having started this business with 15,000 som (KGS). Currently, her herd includes 10 sheep and 2 cows with calves. Nadira earns roughly 15,000 som per month from sales of milk and dairy products.

In order to continue developing her business, Nadira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a downpayment on his own motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Las Diamentes Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO DIAMENTE ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO, SON 9 INTEGRANTES.  ELLAS SON AMIGAS DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS. LA MAYORIA DE SUS INTEGRANTES ,SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO.

MYRNA ALICIA ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, ES CASADA, TIENE 3 HIJOS. DESDE HACE MAS DE 3 AÑOS ELLA  SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE TACOS A VAPOR, UNA COMIDA MUY POPULAR EN MONTERREY. MYRNA PIENSA UTILIZAR SU CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN CARRITO PARA LA VENTA DE TACOS. A ELLA LE GUSTA MUCHO SU TRABAJO YA QUE LE ENCANTA LA COCINA, Y ASI PUEDE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

EL SUEÑO DE MAYRA ES TENER UN PUESTO GRANDE, PARA TENER MAS VARIEDAD DE VENTA DE COMIDA, COMO ANTOJITOS MEXICANO Y ASI PODERLES DAR UN MEJOR FUTURO A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
The Diamente group is a credit support group. They have 9 members who have been friends for several years. Most of the members are merchants.

Myrna Alicia is one of the members of the group. She is married and has 3 children. For more than 3 years she has sold steamed tacos, a very popular food in Monterrey. Myrna plans on using the loan to buy a cart to sell tacos. She really likes her work, since she likes to cook, and this way she can help her husband with the household expenses.

Mayra's dream is to have a big locale to have more variety in the food she sells, such as Mexican delicacies, and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy a taco cart.

loans.name: Bakhadur

texts.ru: Бахдадур трудолюбивый фермер. Он женат и заботливый отец двоих детей. Более 8 лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Жена продает молоко. В первые годы предпринимательства у него было всего пять голов дойных коров и три голов быка. Постепенно расширил бизнес и увеличил поголовье скота, а также купил ферму. Данный момент Бахадур запрашивает займ для ремонта кровли фермы и ограждения вокруг фермы. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bakhadur is a hard-working farmer. He is married and a caring father of two children. For over 8 years, he has been buying and selling cattle, while his wife has been selling milk. In the first years of his business, Bakhadur had only five dairy cows and three bulls. Gradually, he expanded his business, increased the size of his herd, and bought a farm. Presently, he is requesting a loan to repair the roof and fencing on the farm. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his farm

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 44 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, también en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura y posee varios atractivos turísticos como “La Laguna de Huacachina”. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser un Policía.

Con mucho entusiasmo Pedro trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, él le dedica alrededor de 5 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy conocido.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar ropa para la temporada de invierno como chompas, pantalones, buzos, casacas, entre otros, de esta manera el podra tener mas mercaderia para ofrecer a sus clientes, asi el podra seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño: “ Tener su propio local para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Pedro is 44 years old. He is a very hardworking and enthusiastic person. He lives in the city of Ica, which is known for having a warm climate. This city is also known for agriculture and has several tourist attractions, such as Huacachina Lake. When he has some free time, he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends from his neighborhood. He also likes to eat his favorite food, which is the delicious Chinese-style stir-fried rice. He only finished secondary school, but he would have liked to study to become a policeman.

Pedro works with much enthusiasm at his business selling clothing. He works about 5 hours per day and can tend to about 20 customers. He believes things are going well for him in his business because he is very friendly to his customers and above all because he is well known.

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the help they have provided him that he can buy clothing for the winter season, such as pullover sweaters, pants, sweat shirts, and jackets, among other things. This way he will have more merchandise to offer to his customers and he can continue working toward his biggest dream: “To have my own store for my business.”

loans.use: to buy clothing for the winter season (pullover sweaters, jackets, sweatshirts, etc.)

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru: Эмомали добрый и трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Жена помогает по бизнесу.  Данный момент имеет 6 голов крупного рогатого скота для продажи. Эмомали хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота для откорма с целью расширения бизнеса.
